titles.ar: بَابُ فَضْلِ الصَّلَاةِ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ وَ أَفْضَلِ بُقْعَةٍ فِيهِ
titles.en: Chapter 201 – The merits of the Salaat in the Sacred Masjid and the most superior spot therein
Chapter 200 – Praying the complete Salaat in the two Harrams (Masjid Al-Harram and Masjid Al-Medina)

titles.ar: بَابُ فَضْلِ الصَّلَاةِ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ وَ أَفْضَلِ بُقْعَةٍ فِيهِ
titles.en: Chapter 201 – The merits of the Salaat in the Sacred Masjid and the most superior spot therein

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/221)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْجَهْمِ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ أَفْضَلِ مَوْضِعٍ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ يُصَلَّى فِيهِ قَالَ الْحَطِيمُ مَا بَيْنَ الْحَجَرِ وَ بَابِ الْبَيْتِ قُلْتُ وَ الَّذِي يَلِي ذَلِكَ فِي الْفَضْلِ فَذَكَرَ أَنَّهُ عِنْدَ مَقَامِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ( عليه السلام ) قُلْتُ ثُمَّ الَّذِي يَلِيهِ فِي الْفَضْلِ قَالَ فِي الْحِجْرِ قُلْتُ ثُمَّ الَّذِي يَلِي ذَلِكَ قَالَ كُلَّمَا دَنَا مِنَ الْبَيْتِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Al Hassan Bin Al Jaham who said,

‘I asked Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> about the most superior place in the Masjid to be Prayed in. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘الْحَطِيمُ’ ‘Al-Hateem, what is between the (Black) Stone and the Door of the House (Kabah)’. I said, ‘And that which follows that in superiority?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> mentioned that it was by the Standing Place of Ibrahim<sup>as</sup>’. I said, ‘Then which (spot) follows it in superiority?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘By the (Black) Stone’. I said, ‘Then which (spot) follows that?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Every (spot) what is closest to the House (Kabah)’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Faddal from al-Hassan ibn al-Jahm who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, al-Rida, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the most excellent place for salat (prayer) in Masjid al-Haram (the Sacred Masjid). He (the Imam) replied, ’It is al-Hatim, between the Black Stone and the door of the house.’ I then asked, ‘Which place is excellent thereafter?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is Maqam of Ibrahim, ‘Alayhi al-Salam .’ I then asked which one is excellent thereafter?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is inside al-Hijr.’ I then asked, ‘Which is excellent thereafter?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘Whichever is closer to the House.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/221)

narrator_chain.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الصَّلَاةُ فِي الْحَرَمِ كُلِّهِ سَوَاءٌ فَقَالَ يَا أَبَا عُبَيْدَةَ مَا الصَّلَاةُ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ كُلِّهِ سَوَاءً فَكَيْفَ يَكُونُ فِي الْحَرَمِ كُلِّهِ سَوَاءً قُلْتُ فَأَيُّ بِقَاعِهِ أَفْضَلُ قَالَ مَا بَيْنَ الْبَابِ إِلَى الْحَجَرِ الْأَسْوَدِ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan Bin Yahya, from Abu Ayoub Al Khazzaz, from Abu Ubeyda who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullahasws, ‘The Salaat in the Harram, all of it is the same?’ So heasws said: ‘O Abu Ubeyda! The Salaat in the Sacred Masjid is not the same, and how can it happen to be the same in the Harram?’ I said, ‘So which spot is the most superior?’ Heasws said: ‘What is between the Door (of the Kabah) to the Black Stone’.
en.sarwar: 2. Abu Ali al-Ash’ariy has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan ibn Yahya abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz from abu ‘Ubaydah who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, if performing Salat (prayer) in all of al-Haram (the sacred area) is of the same degree of virtue. He (the Imam) said, ‘O abu ‘Ubaydah, all Salat (prayer) in Masjid al-Haram are not of the same degree of virtue; then how can it be the same in all of al-Haram (the sacred area)?’ I then asked, ‘Which part of it is more excellent?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is between the door and the Black Stone.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/222)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْمُلْتَزَمِ لِأَيِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ يُلْتَزَمُ وَ أَيُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ يُذْكَرُ فِيهِ فَقَالَ عِنْدَهُ نَهَرٌ مِنْ أَنْهَارِ الْجَنَّةِ تُلْقَى فِيهِ أَعْمَالُ الْعِبَادِ عِنْدَ كُلِّ خَمِيسٍ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Yunus who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about Al-Multazam (the back part of the Kabah), ‘For which thing is it adhered to, and which thing is mentioned therein?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘By it is a river from the rivers of the Paradise, in which are cast the deeds of the servants, every Thursday’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Faddal from Yunus who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about al-Multazam, for what reason it is held and what is said in it. He (the Imam) said, ‘Nearby there is a canal of the canals of paradise in which the deeds of the servants (of Allah) are thrown every Thursday.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/222)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنِ الْكَاهِلِيِّ قَالَ

text: كُنَّا عِنْدَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ أَكْثِرُوا مِنَ الصَّلَاةِ وَ الدُّعَاءِ فِي هَذَا الْمَسْجِدِ أَمَا إِنَّ لِكُلِّ عَبْدٍ رِزْقاً يُجَازُ إِلَيْهِ جَوْزاً .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Al Kahily who said,

‘We were in the presence of Abu Abdullahasws, so heasws said: ‘Frequent from the Salaat and the supplication in this Masjid. However, for every servant there is sustenance allowed to him within an allowance’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from Ali ibn al-Hakam from al-Kahiliy who has said the following: “Once we were with abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, and he said, ‘You must say a great deal of Salat (prayer) and supplications in this Masjid. There is no doubt that for every servant (of Allah) there is a certain share of sustenance that is passed to him undeniably.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/222)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي سَلَمَةَ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ خَارِجَةَ عَنْ صَامِتٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ( عليهم السلام ) قَالَ

text: الصَّلَاةُ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ تَعْدِلُ مِائَةَ أَلْفِ صَلَاةٍ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Abu Salma, from Haroun Bin Kharjat, from Samit,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws, from hisasws forefathersasws having said: ‘The Salaat in the Sacred Masjid equates to one hundred thousand Salaats (elsewhere)’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from Ali ibn abu Salmah from Flarun ibn Kharijah from Samet who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has narrated from his ancestors, ‘Alayhim al-Salam, who have said that performing Salat (prayer) in Masjid al-Haram is equal to one hundred thousand Salat (prayer) elsewhere.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/222)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ آبَائِهِ ( عليهم السلام ) قَالَ

text: الصَّلَاةُ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ تَعْدِلُ مِائَةَ أَلْفِ صَلَاةٍ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws, from hisasws forefathersasws having said: ‘The Salaat in the Sacred Masjid equates to one hundred thousand Salaats (elsewhere)’.
en.sarwar: 6. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from al-Nawfaliy from al-Sakuniy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has narrated from his ancestors, ‘Alayhim al-Salam, who have said that performing Salat (prayer) in Masjid al-Haram is equal to one hundred thousand Salat (prayer) elsewhere.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/222)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَقُومُ أُصَلِّي بِمَكَّةَ وَ الْمَرْأَةُ بَيْنَ يَدَيَّ جَالِسَةٌ أَوْ مَارَّةٌ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ إِنَّمَا سُمِّيَتْ بَكَّةَ لِأَنَّهَا تَبُكُّ فِيهَا الرِّجَالُ وَ النِّسَاءُ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muawiya Bin Ammar who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullahasws, ‘I stand and Pray Salaat in Makkah, and the woman is seated in front of him, or passes by’. So heasws said: ‘There is no problem. But rather, Makkah has been named as Bakkah, because therein ‘تَبُكُّ’ wail (Baka’a) the men and the women’.
en.sarwar: 7. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘ Umayr from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘I stand up for Salat (prayer) in Makkah and a woman is sitting in front of me or is passing. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful. It is called Bakkah because both men and women weep there.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/223)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ لَهُ الطَّيَّارُ وَ أَنَا حَاضِرٌ هَذَا الَّذِي زِيدَ هُوَ مِنَ الْمَسْجِدِ فَقَالَ نَعَمْ إِنَّهُمْ لَمْ يَبْلُغُوا بَعْدُ مَسْجِدَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَ إِسْمَاعِيلَ ( صلوات الله عليهما ) .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Jameel Bin Darraj who said,

‘Al-Tayyar said to him<sup>asws</sup>, and I was present, ‘This, which is increased, is it from the Masjid?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes, they have not yet reached the remoteness of the Masjid of Ibrahim<sup>as</sup> and Ismail<sup>as</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 8. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘ Umayr from Jamil ibn Darraj who has said the following: “Al-Tayyar once said to him (the Imam), ‘Alayhi al-Salam, when I also was present, ‘This thing which is added, is it of Masjid? He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, it is of Masjid, they still have not reached Masjid of Ibrahim and ‘Isma‘il, May Allah grant both of them favors.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/223)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ فَضَالَةَ بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي بِمَكَّةَ يَجْعَلُ الْمَقَامَ خَلْفَ ظَهْرِهِ وَ هُوَ مُسْتَقْبِلُ الْقِبْلَةِ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ يُصَلِّي حَيْثُ شَاءَ مِنَ الْمَسْجِدِ بَيْنَ يَدَيِ الْمَقَامِ أَوْ خَلْفَهُ وَ أَفْضَلُهُ الْحَطِيمُ وَ الْحِجْرُ وَ عِنْدَ الْمَقَامِ وَ الْحَطِيمُ حِذَاءَ الْبَابِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Husayn Bin Saeed, from Fazalat Bin Ayoub, from Aban, from Zurara who said,

‘I asked himasws about the man who Prayed Salaat in Makkah, ‘Can he make the Standing Place (of Ibrahimas) to be behind his back, and he is facing the Qiblah?’ So heasws said: ‘There is no problem. He can Pray Salaat wherever he so desires to, from the Masjid, be it in front of the Standing Place (of Ibrahimas) or behind it; and the most superior of it is Al-Hateem, and the (Black) Stone, and by the Standing Place (of Ibrahimas); and Al-Hateem is parallel to the Door (of the Kabah)’.
en.sarwar: 9. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from Fadalah ibn Ayyub from Aban from Zurarah who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam), ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who performs Salat (prayer) in Makkah with Maqam (station) of Ibrahim ‘Alayhi al-Salam, behind him, facing al-Qiblah (al-Ka‘bah). He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful. He can perform Salat (prayer) anywhere in the Masjid, in front or behind Maqam (station) of Ibrahim ‘Alayhi al-Salam. More virtuous is al-Hatim and al-Hijr, near Maqam (station) of Ibrahim ‘Alayhi al-Salam and al-Hatim is in front of the door.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/223)

narrator_chain.text: فَضَالَةُ بْنُ أَيُّوبَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كَانَ حَقُّ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ( عليه السلام ) بِمَكَّةَ مَا بَيْنَ الْحَزْوَرَةِ إِلَى الْمَسْعَى فَذَلِكَ الَّذِي كَانَ خَطَّهُ إِبْرَاهِيمُ ( عليه السلام ) يَعْنِي الْمَسْجِدَ .

en.hubeali: Fazalat Bin Ayoub, from Abdullah Bin Sinan,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘A right of Ibrahimas in Makkah was between Al-Hazourat to the Mas’a (area of Sa’ee). So that is which was its line (boundary), meaning the Masjid’.
en.sarwar: 10. Fadalah ibn Ayyub has narrated from ‘ Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘The right of Ibrahim ‘Alayhi al-Salam was from al- Hazwarah to al-Mas‘a’; so it is the quarter which Ibrahim ‘Alayhi al-Salam had marked, that is, the area of the Masjid.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/224)

parts.text: أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي فِي جَمَاعَةٍ فِي مَنْزِلِهِ بِمَكَّةَ أَفْضَلُ أَوْ وَحْدَهُ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ فَقَالَ وَحْدَهُ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Abu Nasr,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassanasws, said, ‘I asked himasws about the man who Prays Salaat in a congregation in his house in Makkah, ‘Is it superior or (him Praying Salaat) alone in the Sacred Masjid?’ So heasws said: ‘Alone’.
en.sarwar: 11. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn abu Nasr who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, if a man performs Salat (prayer) in congregation in his home in Makkah is better or his performing Salat (prayer) in Masjid al-Haram alone. He (the Imam) said, ‘His performing Salat (prayer) in Masjid al-Haram alone is better.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/224)

narrator_chain.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ ثَعْلَبَةَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْحَطِيمِ فَقَالَ هُوَ مَا بَيْنَ الْحَجَرِ الْأَسْوَدِ وَ بَيْنَ الْبَابِ
وَ سَأَلْتُهُ لِمَ سُمِّيَ الْحَطِيمَ فَقَالَ لِأَنَّ النَّاسَ يَحْطِمُ بَعْضُهُمْ بَعْضاً هُنَاكَ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Ibn Fazzal, from Sa’albat, from Muawiya who said,
‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about Al-Hateem. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is what is in between the Black Stone and the Door (of the Kabah)’.
And I asked him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Why has Al-Hateem been named as such?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Because the people squash (Hatam) each other over there’.
en.sarwar: 12. Abu Ali al-Ash’ariy has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from ibn Faddal from Tha’labah from Mu‘awiyah who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about al-Hatim as to why it is called al-Hatim (clashing). He (the Imam) said, ‘It is because people there collide against each other.’”
